- apt-get update just gets a list of new and upgradable packages from the ubuntu repositiries - it doesn't actually perform any upgrades - you need to sudo apt-get update and then sudo apt-get upgrade
- *repositories

- if your getting output like Hit http://gb.archive.ubuntu.com gutsy-updates/multiverse Sources ..... etc and then do apt-get upgrade - if your system says 0 upgraded etc ... then your system is up to date - ie there is nothing to update

- I've seen this error before - I think its due to a possible bug in the gutsy installer - Essentially all your sources for your packages are commented out - wait one and I'll edit it and repastebin it
- might be a little while - stick around and I'll be as quick as I can

- http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/56399/ - that should give you a working sources.list - just copy it to /etc/apt/sources.list. Make a backup of your old one first if you like. Then run sudo apt-get update and then sudo apt-get upgrade. After that you can install new packages! :)
i cant edit and save it
- you need to be superuser to edit that file - copy your old one first - run sudo cp /etc/apt/source.list /etc/apt/sources.list.old and then gksu gedit /etc/apt/sources.list
